intro: Loeselia amplectens f. genuina, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and is native to southern Africa. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its leaves are usually alternate, with a rough or hairy texture. The inflorescence consists of both ray and disk flowers, typical of the daisy family.
